summary: the one with todoroki and self harming was like..... really well written!! i loved it so much!!! a lot of people dont write that...
question: the one with todoroki and self harming was like..... really well written!! i loved it so much!!! a lot of people dont write that topic well and I'm like?????? proud?? almost?? that you're such a good writer!!!!! :)
answer: Aah thank you so much! I was kinda nervous about writing it, because I didn’t know if I could answer it in a way that seemed realistic and helpful, so I’m glad you liked it! Thank you so much! (*≧∀≦*)

blog.name: randomguywithwords
blog.title: Writing about random stuff.
blog.description: Hi, I'm a teenager guy who likes writing so this is mainly for writing-related stuff. I rarely reblog except to answer writing prompts. I welcome any criticism or comments.

title: Sparks (KamiJiro Short Story)
body:
Jiro stirred. Her vision was blurry like an old painting with faded colours that was gradually regaining vitality. Her mouth was dry and her throat cracked. It made her wince. 

Where was she? Apart from her pounding head, nauseating vision and her painful throat, she felt rather comfortable. Linen sheets covered her, and she felt a pillow under her head. White walls surrounded her, and she faintly heard the beeping of hospital equipment. Oh.

“Jiro?” A familiar voice shifted her head towards –

“It’s me, Kaminari,” The blonde boy said, quickly pocketing his handphone and looking at her. “How’re you feeling?”

“Water,” she croaked. Kaminari instantly grabbed a bottle of water by her bedside table and uncapped it. “Sit up,” He said gently, which she did. 

She took the bottle from him and gulped down a few mouthfuls of water. 

“Thank you,” She gasped when she was done. “I’m alright, I guess. Just…bad headache.” 

Kaminari grimaced. “The doctors said it would be a side effect of the toxin. Hagakure said she experienced the same thing. We managed to get rid of the bad parts, though.”

“Hagakure? Is she –”

“She’s fine. She woke up this morning. It’s noon now. Now that you’re up, I should call your parents…”

“Wait, how did you –” 

“They were here when I arrived. I promised I would inform them when you woke up, if you did. We were hopeful, since, y’know, Hagakure did,” Kaminari explained, whilst pulling out his phone. 

Jiro took another few sips as Kaminari was speaking into the phone, giving her time to think. The events of the camp started to return to her, remembering the forest, then a magenta mist, and then nothing more. 

“They’re coming as fast as they can,” Kaminari told her, hanging up. Jiro nodded. 

“What happened?” Jiro asked. “Was there an accident?”

Kaminari’s expression darkened. He explained to her the events at the training camp and then told her of the casualties. When he was done, Jiro’s mouth was hanging open, eyes wide. 

“How did they know about the location?” Jiro was in disbelief. They told us it was safe. They even changed the venue for security reasons. How…?

“We don’t know either,” Kaminari sighed. “But right now with Bakugo’s kidnapping, U.A’s taking a lot of backlash. I feel bad for Aizawa-sensei…”

They sat in silence for a while, till Kaminari spoke up. “I’m sorry.”

“What for?” 

“I don’t know! I spent the whole time in the building doing nothing while others like Midoriya and Shoto were risking their lives. I felt so useless. I could have done something…”

“You sure? You’d probably fry your brain and stumble around like an idiot in the first few seconds,” Jiro teased, causing Kaminari to smile as well. 

“Back to your normal self, I see,” Kaminari murmured. “You know, if you had agreed, maybe I could have protected you.” 

Jiro’s face heated up at the memory. “I thought you were joking about that,” she spluttered. “And even then, it was a toxic gas. You couldn’t do much about that anyway, with me or not.” 

“Still…I – I hate to see you like this,” Kaminari confessed, running a hand through his spiky hair, his cheeks reddening. 

Jiro found herself at a loss for words. “I –”

“Kyoka!” Both teenagers swung their heads to see Jiro’s parents rushing into the ward. 

“Hi Mom, Hi Dad, I’m fine. Mom, really – you don’t have to – ugh…” Jiro sighed in exasperation as her mother began fussing over her, checking her arms and face. Meanwhile, she saw her dad exchange words with Kaminari. He bowed his head, then he turned to Jiro. 

“Bye, Jiro! I’m gonna check on Midoriya.” Kaminari waved his hand. 

“Bye, Kaminari,” Jiro responded, slightly sullen. A part of her wished they weren’t interrupted. Shut up, the other part of her reprimanded.

When he left, her father grinned at her. “Nice boy. You guys aren’t…?”

Her cheeks burned again. “Ew! Dad, no!” 

He shrugged. “Well, I don’t disapprove of him. He seems alright.”

“Dear, that’s enough,” Her mom chided, an edge to her voice. 

He was alright…

She tried, but she couldn’t hide a smile at that.

summary: For the quirk game: i love traveling, my hands are always hot and if i could i’d sleep 24/7
question: For the quirk game: i love traveling, my hands are always hot and if i could i’d sleep 24/7
answer:
yoooooooo i got this one for you i’ve been thinking about this one a lot


your quirk is tele-sleep-tation!


basically, whenever you sleep, you teleport to somewhere else. it was hella scary when it first manifested, believe me. you go to bed one night and wake up somewhere else? wack. Where you wake up depends on what you’re thinking of before you go to bed and sometimes what goes on in your dreams. Good for cutting expenses, bad for when you go through your love-crazy phrase. It was really weird for you, but if you train with it right, you can really master it. Train enough, you could probably close your eyes and move places. Again, the only disadvantage is that it might be somewhat weird. you won’t always show up where you want. want to go to italy? you will probably end up at an italian restaurant but you can get there! with lots of tries!


this is a seriously awesome quirk. while it may be weird at first (like thinking about someone and waking up next to them oh boy), it works out most of the time!

your quirk is tele-sleep-tation!


basically, whenever you sleep, you teleport to somewhere else. it was hella scary when it first manifested, believe me. you go to bed one night and wake up somewhere else? wack. Where you wake up depends on what you’re thinking of before you go to bed and sometimes what goes on in your dreams. Good for cutting expenses, bad for when you go through your love-crazy phrase. It was really weird for you, but if you train with it right, you can really master it. Train enough, you could probably close your eyes and move places. Again, the only disadvantage is that it might be somewhat weird. you won’t always show up where you want. want to go to italy? you will probably end up at an italian restaurant but you can get there! with lots of tries!


this is a seriously awesome quirk. while it may be weird at first (like thinking about someone and waking up next to them oh boy), it works out most of the time!
